reversi

Class NodeComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • reversi.NodeComparator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator

    public class NodeComparator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator
    A class which can be used to compare two Node objects based on the score of each node. This is useful e.g. when implementing beam search since in beam search the best w branches must be selected. The TreeSet class in the java.util package can be used to sort the nodes when used together with a NodeComparator object. An example:
     import java.util.*;

 ...

 TreeSet branches = new TreeSet(new NodeComparator());
 //After this, all nodes added to the branches object will be in descending order based on their scores.
 branches.add(new Node(...));
 //In beam search, the first w nodes must be handled
 for (int i=0, Iterator iter = branches.iterator(); iter.hasNext() && i<w; i++)
   handle((Node)iter.next());

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public int compare(java.lang.Object o1,
          java.lang.Object o2)
        Compares two instances of the Node class based on their scores. The function of this method is inverse to the normal Comparator convention, because the ordered lists of nodes usually need to be in descending, not ascending order.
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator
        Returns:
        a negative, zero or a positive integer, if the score of o2 is lower, equal or higher than the score of o1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if o1 and o2 are not instances of the Node class
